questions.question_text:
An administrator receives a report that no real time statistics are available for a virtual machine in the vCenter Server inventory.
Which two statements indicate likely causes of the problem? (Choose two.)

choices.C: There is insufficient real time data to display the information.
choices.D: The vCenter Server service is not running.
choices.B: The host containing the virtual machine is disconnected from vCenter Server.
choices.A: The virtual machine is powered off.

questions.question_text: Which three actions can be executed when an alarm is triggered? (Choose three.)

choices.A: Datastore is on an NFS 3 storage server that does not support Hardware Acceleration
choices.C: Only VMFS datastores support "Thick Provisioned" VMDK
choices.B: Datastore is on an NFS 4.1 storage server
choices.D: The NFS datastore was not created on a "Thick Provisioned" device

questions.question_text:
An administrator attempts to create a Thick Provisioned Virtual Disk (VMDK) on an NFS datastore; but it fails.
Which two reasons would explain the failure? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
In vSphere 6.0 NFS 4.1 does not support hardware acceleration. This limitation does not allow you to create thick virtual disks on NFS 4.1 datastores.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.0/com.vmware.vsphere.storage.doc/GUID-8A929FE4-1207-4CC5-A086-7016D73C328F.html 

When you upgrade ESXi to version 6.5, existing NFS 4.1 datastores automatically begin supporting functionalities that were not available in the previous ESXi release. These functionalities include Virtual Volumes, hardware acceleration, and so on. In vSphere 6.5, NFS 4.1 does support thick provisioning.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.storage.doc/GUID-8A929FE4-1207-4CC5-A086-7016D73C328F.html

questions.question_text: Which three operations occur during a cold migration of a virtual machine? (Choose three.)

choices.B: The virtual machine is registered with the destination server.
choices.A: The virtual machine disks are moved if the datastore is being changed.
choices.D: The virtual machine hardware is upgraded.
choices.C: The source virtual machine is removed from the old hosts.
choices.E: The virtual machine files are quiesced prior to the migration.

discussion.content:

questions.question_text: Which three traffic types are available services options when configuring a vmkernel port? (Choose three.)
